item.title: Masked Autoencoders: Because Suffering Builds Character (Even for AI)
item.description: Imagine trying to learn a language by only seeing 25% of each sentence. That sounds like a terrible idea, right? Yet this is exactly what Vision Transformer Masked Autoencoders (ViT-MAE) do with images. The paper “Masked Autoencoders Are Scalable Vision Learners” by He et al. showed that hiding 75% of an image (by splitting it into patches and randomly masking 75% of them) and asking a model to reconstruct it produces remarkably powerful visual representations. It turns out that what you don’t see can teach you a lot about what you do.
